poem:
In the Monastery's Shadow

An old man fades  
like leaves underfoot,  
whispering secrets to stone.  
Thirty-two robed figures  
murmur prayers, shadows cast  
by candlelight.  
  
Beyond them,  
a statue holds its breath,  
smoothing the wrinkles  
of past lives, of silence.  
Locked in, yet watching,  
its gaze serene  
as Piedmont cradles  
the whispers of the dying.
